org.conqat.lib.commons.uniformpath

Class UniformPath

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.conqat.lib.commons.uniformpath.UniformPath
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<UniformPath>

    public final class UniformPath
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<UniformPath>, java.io.Serializable
    An absolute uniform path with a specific type, where type might be something like "code", "non-code" or "architecture" (see UniformPath.EType). Never includes a project or repository name. Use UniformPathCompatibilityUtil to create UniformPath instances from String representations.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      static class  UniformPath.EType
      All types a path can have.

    • Method Detail

      • of

        public static UniformPath of(java.lang.String... segments)
        Builds a path from the given segments. The segments must consist of non-empty strings that are not just relative paths (e.g. "." or "..") and may not contain unescaped slashes ("/").
        See Also:
        of(List)

      • of

        public static UniformPath of(UniformPath.EType type,
                             java.lang.String... segments)
        Builds a path from the given segments. The segments must consist of non-empty strings that are not just relative paths (e.g. "." or "..") and may not contain unescaped slashes ("/").
        See Also:
        of(List)

      • of

        public static UniformPath of(UniformPath.EType type,
                             java.util.List<java.lang.String> segments)
        Builds a path from the given segments. The segments must consist of non-empty strings that are not just relative paths (e.g. "." or "..") and may not contain unescaped slashes ("/"). The result is ensured to be of the given type so the according prefix may be present, but does not have to. If the uniform path is of a different type an assertion error is thrown.
        See Also:
        of(List)

      • of

        public static UniformPath of(java.util.List<java.lang.String> segments)
        Builds a path from the given segments. The segments must consist of non-empty strings that are not just relative paths (e.g. "." or "..") and may not contain unescaped slashes ("/").

      • codeRoot

        public static UniformPath codeRoot()
        Returns the code type root path.

      • testRoot

        public static UniformPath testRoot()
        Returns the test type root path.

      • escapeSegment

        public static java.lang.String escapeSegment(java.lang.String segment)
        Escapes uniform path separators in a segment.

      • getParent

        public UniformPath getParent()
        Returns the parent of this path, i.e. a new uniform path without the last segment of this path.

      • getLastSegment

        public java.lang.String getLastSegment()
        Returns the name of the last segment (directory or file) of this path.

      • getSubPath

        public RelativeUniformPath getSubPath(int numberOfTopLevelSegmentsToRemove)
        Returns the sub path relative to the given number of top level path segments. In other words: Remove the given number of top level elements from the path.

        Example: Removing two segments from src/main/java/Class.java will yield the relative path java/Class.java.

      • getSubPathAfter

        public RelativeUniformPath getSubPathAfter(java.lang.String segment)
        Returns the relative sub path after the given segment.

        Example: The subpath after java in src/main/java/Class.java will yield the relative path Class.java.

      • isValidPath

        public static boolean isValidPath(java.lang.String uniformPath)
        Checks whether the given uniform path is valid or not.

      • isRoot

        public boolean isRoot()
        Returns whether this is a root path. Note that there can be multiple root paths, depending on the type (i.e. "-architecture-" and "-non-code-" are both root paths. The path "/" is expanded to "-code-" and is also a root path).

      • isCodePath

        public boolean isCodePath()
        Returns whether this path is a (regular) code path

      • isNonCodePath

        public boolean isNonCodePath()
        Returns whether this path is a non-code path

      • isArchitecturePath

        public boolean isArchitecturePath()
        Returns whether this path is an archicture path

      • isIssuePath

        public boolean isIssuePath()
        Returns whether this path is an issue path

      • isTestPath

        public boolean isTestPath()
        Returns whether this path is a test execution path

      • resolve

        public UniformPath resolve(RelativeUniformPath relativePath)
        Resolves the given relative path against this absolute path, performing path canonicalization in the process (i.e. ".." will be resolved to parent segment).

      • hasAncestor

        public boolean hasAncestor(UniformPath ancestorPath)
        Returns whether the ancestorPath contains this path as a subpath. Example: src is an ancestor of src/main.

      • hasDescendant

        public boolean hasDescendant(UniformPath descendantPath)
        Returns whether this path contains the descendantPath as a subpath. Example: /src/main is a descendant of /src.
